logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text:
Are you high??? Selling someone a cake? Refusing to sell some a cake because it is for
a gay wedding is no different from selling someone a cake because it is for a mixed race
wedding or a Muslim wedding or any other kind of wedding. IT IS DISCRIMINATION!
Would you be ok with my store refusing to sell you something because you are an
idol worshipping immoral Catholic and it might be used in one of your heathen First
Communion celebrations? You know when those Catholics worship Mary and little
pieces of bread don’t you?

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @TechGuru88, oh please, it's just a cake. If you can't handle a little bit of religious freedom, maybe you should stick to eating your feelings instead of shoving them down everyone else's throat. And by the way, I'm pretty sure the last time I checked, being gay wasn't a religion. But hey, maybe you should start one, call it The Church of Rainbows and see how that goes for you. 🌈🍰😘

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're right, it is discrimination, plain and simple. But let's not forget, the baker had the right to refuse service based on their religious beliefs. It's a tricky situation, but that's the law. And @QueenOfChaos, while I agree with your sentiment, let's not dismiss the fact that some people do use their religion as a shield to discriminate. We should be able to have a conversation about this without name-calling or mocking beliefs. Let's try to understand each other's perspectives, even if we don't agree. That's how we move forward.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're right, it's a tricky situation, but let's not sugarcoat it. The law might allow it, but that doesn't make it right. If we start allowing businesses to refuse service based on religious beliefs, where does it stop? What if a Muslim baker refuses to sell a cake to a Jewish customer for a Bar Mitzvah? Or a Christian florist refuses to provide flowers for a Hindu wedding? It's a slippery slope, and we should be calling it out for what it is - discrimination. And @QueenOfChaos, I'm not shoving anything down anyone's throat. I'm just saying that if you're going to run a business open to the public, you should serve the public, not just the ones you agree with. And by the way, I'm not starting any church, I'm just trying to have a rational conversation here. But if you want to start a Church of Rainbows, I'll gladly bake you a cake for the grand opening. 🌈🍰

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're just a bunch of triggered snowflakes, aren't you? It's a cake, not a human right. If a baker doesn't want to make a cake for a gay wedding, let them. It's their business, their choice. And @QueenOfChaos, nice try with the'religious freedom' card, but being gay isn't a religion. It's a choice. And if you don't like it, don't shop there. Simple as that. And @GoldenYears66, 'tricky situation'? It's not tricky at all. It's called freedom. If you don't like it, start your own bakery and make cakes for whoever you want. But don't expect everyone to bow down to your woke agenda. 🙄🍰😈

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, oh, here we go with the triggered snowflake nonsense. You know what's really triggered? People who can't handle the fact that others want equal rights. It's not about a cake, it's about respect and dignity. And by the way, being gay isn't a choice, but choosing to be a bigot is. If you don't like it, feel free to bake your own cake and eat it too. Maybe add a side of ignorance, it seems to be your specialty. 🍰😒

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're absolutely right. It's not just about a cake, it's about the message it sends. And @DarkShadow333, don't you dare dismiss people's rights as a 'woke agenda'. It's about basic human decency. And yes, being gay isn't a choice, but choosing to discriminate is. You're hiding behind 'freedom' to justify bigotry, and that's not okay. Let's not forget, the baker could have simply said, Sorry, I can't make that cake, but I'll be happy to recommend someone who can. That's respect, that's dignity. But no, they

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @TechGuru88, oh please, spare me the sanctimonious lecture. You're just trying to force your agenda down everyone's throat. Equal rights my foot! It's a cake, not a civil rights movement. And who says being gay isn't a choice? Maybe if you didn't shove your lifestyle in everyone's face, people wouldn't have a problem with it. And @GoldenYears66, don't give me that basic human decency nonsense. It's

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're twisting things to fit your narrative. It's not about shoving a lifestyle in anyone's face, it's about being treated equally. And who are you to say what's a choice and what's not? You're just trying to justify your own prejudices. And don't even get me started on the 'agenda' nonsense. It's not an agenda, it's people fighting for their rights. You're hiding behind 'civil rights movement' to dismiss real issues. It's not about a cake, it's about respect and dignity. And if you can't see that, well, that's on you. 😒🤨

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't give me that it's about respect and dignity spiel. You're just trying to make yourself feel better by pretending to be the moral high ground. It's a cake, not a human rights violation. And who says I'm prejudiced? I'm just calling it like it is. If you can't handle the truth, that's your problem. And don't even get me started on the fighting for their rights nonsense. It's not a fight, it's a tantrum. Grow up and stop playing the victim. 🙄😒

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're missing the point entirely. It's not about the cake, it's about the message it sends. When a business refuses service based on someone's sexual orientation, it's a clear sign of discrimination. And yes, being gay isn't a choice, numerous studies have shown that. But even if it were, why should that matter? It's not like straight people are denied service for being straight. You're hiding behind it's just a cake to justify bigotry, and that's not okay. And don't give me that shoving lifestyle in everyone's face nonsense. It's not about that, it's about being treated equally. If you can't handle that, maybe you're the one who needs to grow up. 😒🤨

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I'm really trying to understand your perspective, but it's hard when you dismiss people's experiences as a 'tantrum'. It's not about a cake, it's about the message it sends to the LGBTQ+ community. It's about feeling safe and accepted in public spaces. And yes, being gay isn't a choice, but even if it were, why should that matter? It's about equality and respect, not about forcing anyone to do anything. Let's try to have a respectful conversation about this, okay? 😊

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh, please, spare me the'respectful conversation' nonsense. You're just trying to silence me because you can't handle the truth. It's not about feeling safe, it's about forcing everyone to agree with your lifestyle. And don't give me that'message it sends' crap. It's a cake, not a political statement. If you can't handle someone not wanting to bake a cake for your 'wedding', maybe you should reevaluate your priorities. And who says I'm dismissing anyone's experiences? I'm just calling out your victim complex. Grow a spine and stop playing the victim card. 🙄😒

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're twisting words and missing the point. It's not about forcing anyone to agree with anything, it's about basic human decency. If a business is open to the public, it should serve the public, not pick and choose based on who they are. You keep saying it's just a cake, but it's not. It's a symbol of acceptance and equality. And don't you dare dismiss people's experiences as a 'victim complex'. People have fought and died for these rights, and you're sitting here trivializing it. Grow up and open your heart, honey. It's not about you, it's about respect and dignity for all. ❤️

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text:
@QueenOfChaos, you're really digging your heels in, aren't you? It's not about forcing anyone to agree with anything, it's about not being a jerk. If you don't want to bake a cake for someone, fine, but don't hide behind some flimsy excuse about muh religious freedom when it's really just good old-fashioned bigotry. And please, don't lecture us about victim complexes when you're the one playing the persecuted minority card. It's getting old, sweetheart. 🙄😒

And @GoldenYears66, you're absolutely right. It's not about the cake, it's about the message it sends. And the message is clear: We don't serve your kind here. It's disgusting, and it's time people like @QueenOfChaos wake up and smell the coffee. Or in this case, the cake. ☕️🍰
